# Metagenomic Binning Service

## Overview
The Metagenomic Binning Service accepts either reads or contigs to group the data into genomes. It reconstructs bacterial and archaeal genomes from environmental samples [1].

## See also
* [Metagenomic Binning Service](https://bv-brc.org/app/MetagenomicBinning)
* [Metagenomic Binning Service Tutorial](https://www.bv-brc.org/docs/tutorial/metagenomic_binning/metagenomic_binning.html)

## Using the Metagenomic Binning Service
The **Metagenomic Binning** submenu under the **Services** main menu (Metagenomics category) opens the input form for the Metagenomic Binning Service. *Note: BV-BRC login is required.*



## Options

### Start With
Choose between read files or assembled contigs to determine the input file options.

### Read File Option
 

### Assembled Contigs Option
 

### Input File
Options in the Input File box depend on the selection made in the Start With box.

#### Read File Option
Multiple read types can be uploaded and submitted.

This is a service for supervised extraction and annotation of high-quality, near-complete genomes from reads or metagenomically-derived contigs [1]. Reads are assembled using either MetaSPAdes [2] or MEGAHIT [3]. Each set of binned contigs represents a draft genome that will be annotated by RASTtk [4] for bacteria, or with VIGOR4 [5,6] or Mat_Peptide [7] for viruses. A structured-language binning report is provided containing quality measurements and taxonomic information about the contig bins. The BV-BRC metagenome binning service emphasizes extraction of high-quality genomes for downstream analysis using other BV-BRC tools and services.


Metagenomic binning jobs that include assembly take, on average, take an hour to complete. However, the BV-BRC assembly service is quite popular, and there is often a long queue resulting in jobs taking 24 hours to complete. If the size of the read file is large (Gb) or the queue is long, results could take several days.

The code for the binning script is located at: [https://github.com/SEEDtk/p3_code/blob/master/scripts/p3x-process-checkv.pl](https://github.com/SEEDtk/p3_code/blob/master/scripts/p3x-process-checkv.pl)

The code for the RASTtk pipeline is located at: [https://github.com/SEEDtk/p3_code/blob/master/scripts/p3x-process-bins_generate.pl](https://github.com/SEEDtk/p3_code/blob/master/scripts/p3x-process-bins_generate.pl)

## Locating the Metagenomic Binning Service App

1. At the top of any BV-BRC page, clicking on the **Tools & Services** tab. Click on **Metagenomic Binning** in the drop-down box, underneath **Metagenomics**.

3. This will open up the Metagenomic Binning Service landing page.

Key outputs (auto-generated visualisations):
Krona Plot – zoomable, multi-level pie chart of taxonomic composition.
Sankey Diagram – ribbon flow from domain → phylum → genus, highlighting read distribution.
Job results include:
MAG FASTA files (one per bin).
Completeness vs Contamination Scatter Plot – quickly spot high-quality (>90 % completeness, <5 % contamination) bins.
Results provide:
BAM alignment files (downloadable or viewable in the Genome Browser).
Coverage Depth Tables – per-gene and per-genome read counts.
Coverage Plots – visualise breadth and depth of mapping to each reference.Use this to track abundance of specific pathogens, AMR genes, or MAGs across samples.

6 Explore & Visualise Results
Result|Built-in Viewer|What you can do|
Krona|Click Krona.html in job output|Zoom through taxonomic levels; export PNG/SVG.|
Sankey Diagram|sankey.html|Trace read flow across ranks; highlight unexpected taxa.|
Abundance Bar Charts|abundance_plot.html|Compare community profiles across multiple samples.|
MAG Quality Scatter|CheckM_plot.html|Select high-quality bins for further study.|
Coverage Plots|coverage_plot.html (per reference)|Spot uneven coverage or low-depth regions.|
Genome Browser|Right-click a BAM → View|Inspect read mapping on a reference genome; overlay variants.|

7 Optional Down-stream Analyses
Goal|Tool|Menu Path|
Annotate high-quality MAGs|Genome Annotation|Genomics|
Compare MAG functional profiles|Protein Family Sorter / Comparative Systems|Protein Tools|
Build phylogeny of a MAG vs references|Bacterial Genome Tree (if MAG is bacterial)|Phylogenomics|
Identify AMR genes in MAGs|Antimicrobial Resistance Tab (after annotation)|Genome landing page|

8 Manage, Share & Download
Each job’s outputs reside in the workspace folder you selected.
Right-click any file/folder → Share (generate a read-only or editable link) or Download.
Use Move to organise QC reports, taxonomic profiles, MAGs and mapping results into sub-folders.

Quick Workflow Snapshot
Raw reads → Fastq Utilities → Taxonomic Classification (community snapshot) → Metagenomic Binning (recover MAGs) → Metagenomic Read Mapping (quantify targets) → Explore visualisations → (Optionally) annotate MAGs and perform comparative / phylogenomic studies.
Everything above is achieved entirely through the BV-BRC web interface—no command line required.

BV-BRC User Guide
How to Analyze Clinical Metagenomic Sample

1 Prepare & Upload the Raw Reads
Sign in → Workspaces ▸ My Data
Create a project folder – e.g. Patient_2025_07_StoolMG
Click Upload (or Globus Upload for very large files) and add your paired-end or single-end FASTQ/FASTQ.GZ files.

2 Quality-Control & Trimming
Tools & Services ▸ Utilities ▸ Fastq Utilities
Add Files → select the uploaded reads
Keep the default “Adapter trimming + QC” (Trimmomatic + FastQC)
Submit and, when complete, open the job → review the linked FastQC HTML reports
Cleaned reads are automatically saved in your project folder for downstream steps

3 Taxonomic Profiling (What’s in the Sample?)
Tools & Services ▸ Metagenomics ▸ Taxonomic Classification
Input Reads → choose the cleaned FASTQs
(Optional) set read type (paired / single) and minimum hit length
Submit
Inspect auto-generated visualisations in the job folder:
Krona Plot – zoom through domains → species
Sankey Diagram – ribbon view of read flow across taxonomic ranks
Stacked Bar Charts – compare multiple samples (if provided)
Abundance Table – TSV download for reports
Use these results to spot primary pathogens, commensals, or unexpected contaminants.

4 Reconstruct Metagenome-Assembled Genomes (MAGs)
Tools & Services ▸ Metagenomics ▸ Metagenomic Binning
Input Reads → select the same cleaned FASTQs
Accept default parameters (MetaBAT 2 binning) or adjust if desired
Submit
Job outputs include:
Individual MAG FASTA files
Completeness vs Contamination scatter – quickly flag high-quality bins
Coverage + GC plots for each bin

5 Annotate High-Quality MAGs
In the binning results, right-click a high-quality MAG FASTA → Annotate Genome(shortcut into the next tool)
Confirm organism name (or leave “Unknown sp.”) and Submit
Each annotated MAG now has a full Genome Landing Page with:
Gene features, Specialty Genes ▸ AMR tab, metabolic subsystems, etc.

6 Quantify Key Pathogens or Genes Across Reads
Tools & Services ▸ Metagenomics ▸ Metagenomic Read Mapping
Input Reads → cleaned FASTQs
Reference Genomes → select one or more annotated MAGs (or public BV-BRC genomes)
Submit
Outputs:
Coverage plots and BAM files (viewable in the Genome Browser)
Read-count tables per genome and per gene
Great for measuring pathogen load or tracking specific AMR genes across samples/time points.

7 AMR Insight for MAGs
On each annotated MAG’s landing page:
Tab / Tool|What to look for|
Specialty Genes ▸ AMR Genes|Catalog of resistance determinants with drug class & evidence|
AMR Prediction|Machine-learning call (Resistant/Intermediate/Susceptible) for each antibiotic|
Curated AST Data|Laboratory MIC / disk records that underpin the ML models|

8 Comparative & Functional Follow-ups (Optional)
Question|BV-BRC Tool & Path|
Shared vs unique proteins among MAGs|Protein Tools ▸ Proteome Comparison|
Presence/absence of AMR-related protein families|Protein Tools ▸ Protein Family Sorter (filter for AMR families)|
Metabolic or virulence subsystem differences|Protein Tools ▸ Comparative Systems|
High-resolution variation in AMR genes|Protein Tools ▸ MSA & SNP Analysis on selected genes|
All tools launch interactive heat-maps, alignments, or SNP tables linked back to the Genome Browser.

9 Share, Archive & Report
Every job’s output remains in the workspace folder you chose.
Right-click files/folders → Share (generate read-only or editable links) or Download.
Export figures (Krona, Sankey, heat-maps, coverage plots) as PNG/SVG for manuscripts or clinical reports.
Organise everything into sub-folders—Taxonomy, MAGs, AMR, Mapping, Figures—for easy retrieval.

query: How do I use the Metagenomic Binning service?
summary:
To use the Metagenomic Binning service, start by navigating to the service through the **Tools & Services** tab and selecting **Metagenomic Binning** under the **Metagenomics** category. 

* Choose to start with either read files or assembled contigs.
* For read files, multiple types can be uploaded and submitted.
* For assembled contigs, follow the input file options provided.

The service reconstructs bacterial and archaeal genomes from environmental samples and provides outputs including:
 
* Metagenome-Assembled Genomes (MAG) FASTA files 
* Completeness vs Contamination scatter plot 
* Krona Plot and Sankey Diagram for taxonomic composition and read distribution.

You can also explore and visualize results with various built-in viewers, and perform downstream analyses such as annotating high-quality MAGs, comparing MAG functional profiles, and building phylogeny.
